newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar mostly lower on trade selling.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar mostly lower on trade selling.

text.p: White sugar futures drifted lower as the continued pressure of light trade selling kept nearby values away from their earlier highs, traders said on Wednesday.

Two leading trade houses were mentioned as persisent sellers throughout the day but attention was concentrated on the fortunes of the New York March contract, poised to break through 11.00 cents/lb and touch off buy stops.
Some commission house buying was noted to offset the trade sales, which ensured that price movements remained tight, and a number of crossed May trades were reported.
At 1655 GMT May was down 30 cents at $307.20, off the earlier high at $307.50 resistance. August was down 40 cents at $306.70 and volume amounted to 1,273 lots.
